content: Statistics is the study of collecting, organizing, analyzing, interpreting, and presenting data. You'll learn about different ways to represent data (like graphs and charts), measures of central tendency (mean, median, mode), and measures of spread (range, variance, standard deviation). Statistics helps us make sense of the world around us and draw conclusions from data.

questions.question: What is the most common measure of central tendency?
Which measure of central tendency is best for data with outliers?
The data set {2, 4, 4, 5, 7, 9} has a mode of:
What is the range of the data set {1, 3, 5, 7, 9}?
Which measure of spread tells us how much the data varies from the mean?
A bar graph is best used to represent:
A pie chart is useful for showing:
If a data set is skewed to the right, the mean will be:
What is the purpose of sampling in statistics?
options: To collect data from the entire population
To make inferences about a population based on a smaller group
To ensure everyone in the population is represented
To avoid bias in data collection
questions.correct_answer: To make inferences about a population based on a smaller group
